009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import java.awt.color.ICC_ColorSpace;
012
013import imagingbook.common.color.cie.NamedIccProfile;
014
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * This color space class is based on the "AdobeRGB1998.icc" profile [1]. It only serves as an example for creating color
019 * spaces from ICC profiles. This color space uses D65 as its white point, primaries are the columns of matrix
020 * </p>
021 * <pre>
022 *             | 0.57667, 0.18556, 0.18823 |
023 *     Mrgbi = | 0.29734, 0.62736, 0.07529 |
024 *             | 0.02703, 0.07069, 0.99134 |</pre>
025 * <p>
026 * See Sec. 14.5 of [2] for details.
027 * This is a singleton class with no public constructors, use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
028 * </p>
029 * <p>
030 * [1] https://www.adobe.com/digitalimag/pdfs/AdobeRGB1998.pdf<br>
031 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
032 * (2022).
033 * </p>
034 *
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2023/03/17
037 * @see NamedIccProfile#AdobeRGB1998
038 */
039@SuppressWarnings("serial")
040public class AdobeRgbColorSpace extends ICC_ColorSpace {
041
042    private static AdobeRgbColorSpace instance = null;
043
044    private AdobeRgbColorSpace() {
045        super(NamedIccProfile.AdobeRGB1998.getProfile());    // constructor of ICC_ColorSpace
046    }
047
048    /**
049     * Returns a singleton instance of {@link AdobeRgbColorSpace}.
050     * @return an instance of {@link AdobeRgbColorSpace}
051     */
052    public static AdobeRgbColorSpace getInstance() {
053        if (instance == null) {
054            instance = new AdobeRgbColorSpace();
055        }
056        return instance;
057    }
058
059}
